str2: All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
An island. Probably from the base of naus; an island.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To flee, escape, shun. Apparently a primary verb; to run away; by implication, to shun; by analogy, to vanish.
No, not. Also ouk, and ouch a primary word; the absolute negative adverb; no or not.
A mountain, hill. Probably from an obsolete oro; a mountain: -hill, mount(-ain).

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Plural
str2: A prolonged form of a primary heuro, which heureo is used for it in all the tenses except the present and imperfect to find.
